The ringer volume is set according to the current noise level the microphone detects. The noise levels correspond to the minimum and the maximum ringer volume.
Minimum level: Select the level of ambient noise for which the lowest ringer volume is suitable (default:0).

Maximum level: Select the level of ambient noise for which the highest ringer volume is needed. Increase this value if your ringer is too loud in silent situations. Decrease it if your ringer should be louder in silent situations (default:7000).

Test your settings by clicking the buttons. On success the ambient noise level and the new volume is reported. Cover the proximity sensor to test if the vibration is correctly working (\'-\' device is covered, \'+\' device is not covered).\n\n Notifications can only be detected if the accessibility service is running.
